dialogues.text: Miller looks at Reiben, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reiben, what's the matter with you? I don't gripe to you.  I'm a captain. There's a chain of command.  Griping goes one way, up, only up, never down.  You gripe to me, I gripe to my superior officers.  Up, get it? I don't gripe to you, I don't gripe in front of you.  How long you been in the army?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir, I apologize. (beat) But if you weren't a captain, or if I were a major, what would you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller considers his response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that case, I would say this is an excellent mission, with an extremely valuable objective, worthy of my best efforts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reiben rolls his eyes.  Miller plays it straight, with no obvious sarcasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) In addition, as I pointed out earlier, I have a fondness for cheese and I hope to have the opportunity to sample some of the Ramelle products, when we arrive there, to see if they live up to their excellent reputation. Moreover, I feel heartfelt sorrow for the mother of Private James Ryan and I'm more than willing to lay down my life, and the lives of my men, especially you, Reiben, to help relieve her suffering.  The men thoroughly enjoy the performance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, if you were not a captain, I would compliment you, now, for being an excellent liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I am a captain.  If I were not a captain, I would thank you for the compliment and tell you that the ability to lie comes from being a top-notch poker player, which I am, having learned at the side of my mother who is, by popular acclaim, the best poker player in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men all  learn forward expectantly, believing they're about to find out Miller's home town.  Miller smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ...my home town, which shall remain un-named.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men ease back, disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any further thoughts on the subject?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, as a final note, I'd like to say, fuck our orders, fuck Ramelle, fuck the cheese capital of France and while we're at it, fuck Private James Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make a note of your suggestions but I'll leave that last one to you, especially if he's already dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men wince and laugh.  Miller checks his watch and get serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move out in two hours, try and get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men know when to can it.  Without another word, they settle down into the debris, close their eyes and try to follow Miller's order.  Upham looks around at these stran men, then, a simple, hard glare from Miller makes him fol suit. Miller looks at his men, then pulls out his map case and flashlight.  He turns it on, in the dim glow of the light he studies his maps while his men rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark.  ARTILLERY RUMBLES IN THE DISTANCE.  Reiben, Jackso Wade and Upham sleep.  Miller still sits in the glow of h flashlight, studying his maps.  Sarge lies near him, awak watching him.  Sarge notices some unopened envelopes in Miller's map case and speaks quietly to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever going to open those letters? Miller keeps his eyes on the maps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not normal, not reading letters from home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when have things been normal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got me.  Afraid of bad news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller looks at Sarge.  A moment passes between the two o them, then miller takes refuge in the maps.  Sarge looks the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they'll be alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're fine.  As long as they can gripe, they'll be alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller considers the question, doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They guys here aren't going to be able to hold out until battalion shows up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Command isn't going to let them withdraw and the Germans sure as hell aren't going to let them surrender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three for three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we stayed, we could make a difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit in silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope this boy Ryan is worth it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're the one kidding yourself. (beat) Hell of  a mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup, hell of a mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller looks at his watch, rises and barks at the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rise and shine, boys.  Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grumbling, the men get up and start shouldering up their gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMALL ARMS FIRE ECHOES through the village.  DISTANT ARTI BOOMS.  Miller leads his men from the ruins of the cathed toward the outskirts of town.  They're just a small squad but these six, heavily-armed men, in full battle gear, ar very formidable-looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller's men are getting ready to move out.  Captain Hami and a few of his men are there to see them off.  Suddenly

dialogues.speaker: A FLASH OF LIGHT APPEARS ON THE HORIZON
dialogues.text: Then REPEATED FLASHES OF LIGHT.  The sky is on fire.  The AIR TREMBLES.  A FAR OFF RUMBLING THUNDER ROLLS over the countryside like a tidal wave. Then, THE OPPOSITE HORIZON LIGHTS UP AS WELL. IT'S A MASSIVE ARTILLERY BATTLE.  The MAGNITUDE OF THE FU is incredible, strange, other-worldly. EVERY MAN THERE IS TRANSFIXED. Frozen in place.  The lights play on their faces. MILLER looks down and sees his hand quivering. SARGE notices, says nothing. MILLER stares at his hand, forcing it to stop.  Their eye go back to the BLAZING SKY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awe-struck) Makes you feel small, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upham's face shows more fear than awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't made for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitterly) You think the rest of us were?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upham recoils.  Miller instantly regrets his words.  He t to Upham and sees that he's really scared.  Miller get a hold of himself and speaks gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Upham, God'll protect you, this shit's gonna keep him up all night, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upham manages a slight smile.  Miller watches the lights a moment more, then he pretends to shrug it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, this ain't what they pay us for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Hamill is next to snap himself out of it.  He poi the way. Captain hamill Along the wall, about thirty yards, there' gate, on the other side, a drainage ditch, stay low until you clear the second field, then you'll hit the woods. As Miller and his men shoulder their gear and prepare to move out, on of Captain Hamill's men, the Gentle-Faced Pr who was so interested in the talk of Private Ryan, steps with a couple bandoleers of B.A.R. ammo.  He offers them Reiben. Gentle-faced private Here. Reiben looks at the bandoleers and is about to give a sma ass response, when a look at the Gentle-Faced Private's vulnerable expression stops the comment dead. Gentle-faced private My older brother was killed at Guadalcanal...these might come in handy. Reiben takes the ammo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) Just what I need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller steps over, takes the bandoleers from Reiben and h them back to the Gentle-Faced Private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, but you may need these more than us, or Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Hamill nods to the Gentle-Faced Private who takes the ammo back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's move out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller and his men head off along the wall into the darkn lit intermittently by the distant flashes.  Captain Hamil and his beleaguered men, watch them go with dread and a strange bit of hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FINAL RUMBLES of the DISTANT ARTILLERY fade away.  Th night is dark.  The band of six Americans makes their way warily along a French cart path.  Sarge eases up alongsid Miller and speaks quietly to him.  The others don't overh Sarge How long's your hand been shaking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of weeks.  It started in Portsmouth when they brought us down for loading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it getting worse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  It comes and goes.  It stops when I look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may have to find yourself a new line of work, this one doesn't seem to agree with you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarge looks at Miller, closely, evaluating him, they walk on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farther along.  The men are tired but alert.  Jackson is point.  Miller behind him.  The others at intervals.  Sar brings up the rear. A SOUND.  Jackson stops.  No one speaks, they communicate only with hand signals. JACKSON SIGNALS to Miller, ten, twenty, thirty men coming MILLER SIGNALS for the men to get off the path.  They eas into the brush.  An instant later, a PAIR WARY GERMAN INF MEN appear. REIBEN grips his B.A.R. and looks to Miller for permissio to open up.  Miller shakes his head and signals, "let the go." A moment later AN ENTIRE PLATOON OF GERMANS rounds t bend.  Fifty men.  Heavily armed.  REIBEN breathes a sigh relief and lowers hi B.A.R. THE GERMAN PLATOON passes, their boots no more than two f from the faces of the hidden Americans.  Upham is wide-ey with fear.  The others are stone-faced. THE GERMANS PASS. MILLER MOTIONS for his men to hold their positions. UPHAM doesn't see the signal.  He stands, breathing a sig of relief, just as a GERMAN WHIP-TAIL SQUAD appears, trai the platoon by thirty meters, protecting their rear. UPHAM FREEZES.  He's standing, barely in the shadows, nea exposed.  Shitting bricks. Pissed, MILLER prepares to fire.  The Whip-tail squad approaches. Then, the GERMANS PASS, miraculously, not seeing Upham in the shadows.  They walk on and disappear.  Upham is weak- kneed, amazed that he's still alive. MILLER shoots a devastating glare at him, then signals th rest of the men to follow him into the woods.  Upham scur after Miller, staying close on his heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little band of Americans walks along the edge of a fi parallel to a cart path.  Wary. Miller notices Jackson and Wade drifting too close to eac other.  He SNAPS HIS FINGERS, getting their attention, an motions curtly for them to open it up a bit.  They do so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark.  FAINT DISTANT ARTILLERY.  Miller checks the map as Sarge shines a red flashlight on an array of directional signs.  One of them reads:  "Ramelle 16 Km." Miller puts away the map.  Checks the horizon.  The first glow of daw is visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be light, soon.  Let's pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First light.  The SOUND OF DISTANT GUNS has been replaced the CHIRPING OF BIRDS.  The Americans are taking five. Miller stands, a bit apart from the others, looking out a the view.  It's lovely.  Dew shimmers on the long grass. The war is far away. Upham walks next to him.  They look out at the view toget without speaking for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like a Renoir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Do you know Sibelius' Fourth Symphony, The Normandy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been humming it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seemed appropriate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know classical music?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you from, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the pool up to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upham smiles, caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over three-hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what, if I'm still alive when it hits five-hundred, I'll let you know and we'll split the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's the way you feel, why don't we wait until it's up to a thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't expect to live that long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upham looks closely at Miller and sees that he means it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five hundred, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller takes a last look at the view and allows himself t feel an overwhelming wave of sadness.  Then he turns hims back into a commander and barks at Upham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller strides away.  Upham watches him, trying to figure him out, then he simply follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The seven Americans walk along a hedgerow lane, untouched war.  Spreading trees arch gently over the lane which is lined with hedgerows, thick, rooted masses, impenetrable, hundred of years old. Miller sees SMOKE AHEAD.  He motions to the men.  They advance.  Ext. french farm - day A burning house and barn An old FRENCH FARMER kneels on the ground, weeping, next this SLAUGHTERED FAMILY, two adult women, an adult male a a boy, no more than ten.  His animals, a pair of cows and draft horse and some pigs are dead as well, shot to piece A DEAD AMERICAN PARATROOPER lies sprawled in the dirt wit empty shell casings around his body. Miller and his men approach carefully.  Miller motions to Upham who squats down next to the French Farmer and speak gently to him in French. The FARMER SPEAKS SOFTLY as if in a trance.  Upham stands and translates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five nights ago, he found this paratrooper caught in a tree with a broken leg.  The leg got infected. Last night he went to Ville Cholet to get a doctor.  The doctor refused to come and when he got back, this is what he found.  The Krauts must have shown up while he was gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he see any sign of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upham gently asks.  The FARMER ANSWERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but he heard firing, just east, less that a kilometer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank him and tell him we're sorry about his loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller heads off without glancing back.  The men hesitate Sarge jerks his head for them to move out.  They do so. Upham squats down and speaks softly to the Farmer, puts h hand on the man's shoulder, then rises and follows the ot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful, hedgerow-lined field of tall grass.  The las of the dew and morning mist is just burning off. The six Americans walk carefully through the woods to the edge of the field. Miller notices something.  He silently signals stop, crou and scans the field and the hedgerow on the far side. Sarge and Jackson ease up next to him.  Jackson points to some trees nearby, freshly shattered and pock-marked with bullets. Wade calls quietly from a tangle of roots and brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staying low, they join Wade who has found:

dialogues.speaker: TWO DEAD AMERICAN PARATROOPERS
dialogues.text: A trail of blood and flattened grass leads from the field

dialogues.speaker: MILLER, SARGE AND JACKSON
dialogues.text: Crawl to the edge of the field, scan the far hedgerow.  T others crawl up behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the shadow by those two trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My guess, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A machine gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller eases back from the edge of the field into the cov of the brush.  He stands and takes off his pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I've got an idea, let's go around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't leave it here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We left them eighty-eights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't send planes to put out machine guns. (beat) Two flank runners with surpressing fire.  I'm going right, whoever goes left has to be fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upham steels himself and steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I ran the 220 in high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fast, Captain, I saw him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller takes Upham's measure.  Wade laughs with a sneer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How fast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-four-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, that's nothing, I ran twenty- two flat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade goes left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade joins Miller in peeling off his extra gear.  Upham i impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-two flat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade takes a grenade from Upham's chest strap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have won the states if some bastard hadn't tripped me in the finals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller points the others to their firing positions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarge, Upham, here.  Jackson, Reiben, ten yards, either side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they take their positions, Miller and Sarge speak quie out of earshot of the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rule of thumb, Captain, says you ought to detail this one, instead of going yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller looks at the two dead paratroopers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  What rule of thumb is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about I go right, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you take your position?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarge hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) How about you shut up and take your position?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarge nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarge finds a spot.  Miller joins Wade.  Miller waits nea Upham as the other men settle into their firing positions

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't need it, I'm a cat, I've got five lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men said, nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do they know? (beat) I had nine, but I feel through the ice when I was seven, my brother pulled me out.  Then I used one when a grenade landed in my foxhole in Sicily, it was a dud.  I figure one on the beaches, one on the cliffs and two getting here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That only leaves three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller sees that the men are in position.  He nods to Wad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller and Wade take deep breaths.  Miller Now. MILLER AND WADE TAKE OFF AT FULL RUNS. Onto opposite sides of the field.  Nothing happens for a moment.  Then: A HEAVY GERMAN MACHINE GUN OPENS UP.  MURDEROUSLY LOUD. SHATTERING THE QUIET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A squad of Germans, dug deep, BLASTING THE MACHINE GUN, a BIG SCHWARZLOSE 8MM, a stunningly powerful weapon. Four Germans in the nest, four more outlying riflemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes the FIRST FIRE.  He HITS THE DIRT.  The BULLETS SCREAM just over him.

dialogues.speaker: WADE HITS THE DIRT
dialogues.text: The BULLETS GRAZE the back of his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE, REIBEN, JACKSON, UPHAM
dialogues.text: Zero the machine gun.  FIRE fast as they can.  Their BULL THUD INEFFECTUALLY into the hedgerow.

dialogues.speaker: SPRINTS MILLER HITS THE DIRT
dialogues.text: Bullets SMASH into the ground all around Miller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIRES A LONG BURST from his Thompson. No effect.  Pissed.  POPS THE CLIP. SLAMS in another.  FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: THE MACHINE GUN SWINGS FROM MILLER
dialogues.text: He rises and runs.  Fast.  Almost to the far hedgerow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten more yards.  Too slow.  A deadly row of BULLETS KICK UP DIRT toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes it to the far side.  Scrambles up the roots.  Dives through the brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a slight rise.  Can't hit the dirt.  A line of bullets.  Desperately sprints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WADE IS HIT.  HEAVY BULLETS RIP APART HIS BELLY.  He spin Goes down. SARGE, UPHAM AND THE OTHERS are horrified.  FIRE at the n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRUGGLES through the hedgerow. Stumbles onto the path.  Rolls to his feet, running.  Swings his Thompson into firing position.  Racing toward the nest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARGE AND THE OTHERS POUR FIRE at the nest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tearing along the path.  Sees a German rifleman.  FIRES A BURST.  CUTS HIM DOWN.  Runs over the body without breaking stride.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE STEPS INTO THE OPEN, INTENTIONALLY DRAWING THE GERM
dialogues.text: FIRE from Miller. The GERMANS ZERO SARGE.  BULLETS THUD all around him.  So he's not hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEARS THROUGH THE TREES.  BLASTS his Thompson.  CUTS DOWN two more German riflemen.  Grabs a grenade.  Pulls the pin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Germans see Miller coming.  Wheel from Sarge.  Too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROWS the grenade, VEERS and DIVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE GRENADE EXPLODES.  The four Germans in the nest are KILLED. SARGE hollers to the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD YOUR FIRE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolls to his feet.  FIRE another BURST.  KILLS the last of the German riflemen.  Doesn't pause.  RUNS onto the field.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE AND THE OTHERS
dialogues.text: See Miller running toward Wade.  They instantly RACE onto the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lies in the grass.  Holding his belly. Astonished by the pain.

dialogues.speaker: ALL THE AMERICANS RUN
dialogues.text: Converging on Wade.  Miller points, and yells, without sl down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REIBEN, UPHAM, PERIMETER!  COVER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop instantly.  Turn toward the perimeter of the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roots through his medical kit as he runs.  Dropping and scattering inessentials behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide-eyed.  Not even writhing.  Too much pain.

dialogues.speaker: MILLER AND SARGE GET TO WADE
dialogues.text: Throw themselves onto the ground next to him.  They both tear out sulfa-packs.  Sarge frantically fumbles.  Rippin one open.  Powder spills. REIBEN AND UPHAM repeatedly glance back at Wade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulls Wade's hands from the wound. Pours sulfa powder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About to pour his sulfa.  Sees the wound.  Stops.  Knows it's fatal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throws the sulfa aside.  Quickly pulls out a morphine pac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fumbles with a second sulfa bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulfa, more sulfa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frozen in agony.  Looks at Miller. Sees him preparing the morphine shot. They both know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...morphine...make it a double...huh...Captain...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOVES THE NEEDLE into Wade's neck. Thick vein.  Pumps the morphine straight to Wade's brain.  Motions impatiently to Sarge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More morphine, hurry up, come on, come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesitates.  Then drops his sulfa. Fumbles in his pack.  Finds the morphine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatches the morphine from Sarge. Quickly and efficiently prepares a second shot.  He's done this before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On guard, glancing back.  Pissed off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it...Goddamn it...Goddamn it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freaked out.  Trying to keep his eyes on the perimeter.  Can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gives Wade the second shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feels the effects of the first shot. He sees Upham and manages a pained smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WADE LOCKS EYES WITH MILLER.  Looking at him without blam without forgiveness.  Drifts with the morphine.  Then: WA

dialogues.speaker: ALL ARE FROZEN IN PLACE
dialogues.text: UPHAM begins to weep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it...Goddamn it...Goddamn it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is silent.  Motionless.  He gently closes Wade's eyes.  His hand quivers slightly as he unclips one of Wades dogtags.  He fumbles and drops it. Sarge notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller stares at his hand and steadies it before the men see.  He picks up the dogtag and pockets it. Then Miller carefully re-packs the un-used morphine and s rises and picks up his Thompson. Upham shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was no twenty-two flat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller SLAMS A FRESH CLIP into his Thompson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lied.  Let's move out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller turns and walks away without looking back.  The me hesitate, then slowly follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A narrow footpath, arched over by trees, almost a tunnel. The five G.I.'s walk, spread out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck Private James Ryan, fuck him, just fuck the goddamned son-of-a- bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shut up, this is the most fucked up mission I ever heard of.  Goddamned Ryan, fuck the little bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just shut up, Ryan didn't kill Wade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell he didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller motions to them curtly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shut up.  Miller falls in step to Sarge.  Speaks qui the men don't hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to find someplace to hole up for a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarge looks at Miller closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just find someplace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller leads the men into a heavily overgrown gully.  A g hiding place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rest.  One hour.  Jackson, Reiben, perimeter.  Keep your eyes open. I'm going to re-con.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller speaks authoritatively and says the right things, there's something missing.  It's subtle.  Only Sarge noti He watches Miller head off into the brush alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller walks into a small clearing, slows then stops.  Th life drains from him.  He stands there, looking at the di tilting his head, this way and that, as if listening for faint, distant voices.  His face shows a battle raging wi as he fights to keep from losing it entirely.  Behind him Sarge steps to the edge of the clearing and watches.  Mil senses his presence, turns and looks at him if he were a thousand miles away.  Sarge sits down on a log and waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the name of that kid at Anzio, the one who got his face burned off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vecchio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Vecchio, I couldn't remember his name, he was a good kid, remember how he used to walk on his hands and sing that song about the man on flying trapeze?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why I'm such a good officer? Because of my mother.  Have I ever told you about her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bits and pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the best poker player you ever saw.  My father used to go to these Saturday night games and lose his shirt.  Finally, my mother gave him an ultimatum, either she gets a regular seat at the table or she locks him in every Saturday night. He squawked and so did his buddies but after a while they gave in and from the first night she sat down, she never lost.  She could read those cocky bastards like they were playing open hands.  And he bluffs?  He had sixteen levels of bullshit.  Her eyes, the tone of her voice, her bets, her jokes, the way she sipped her coffee, she was a master.  She won more money on shit hands than anyone in the history of the game. Every Saturday night, my father would lose two, three hundred bucks and she'd win it all back and then some. And I'd stand there, glued to her shoulder, from the time I was five years old, watching every hand, every move, studying how she did it. (beat) That's why I'm such a good officer, I can look at a man's face and tell you exactly what he's holding, and if it's a shit hand, I know just what cards to deal him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about your own hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.  A pair of deuces?  Less? So what?  I bluff.  It used to tear me apart when I'd get one of my men killed, but what was I supposed to do?  Break down in front of the ones who were standing there waiting for me to tell them what to do?  Of course not, so I bluffed, and after a while, I started to fall for my own bluff. It was great, it made everything so much easier.  Sarge Is that why your hand's been shaking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be worse.  You know the first thing they teach you at O.C.S.? Lie to your men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in so many words, but they tell you you can have all the firepower in the world and if your men don't have good morale, it's not worth a damn.  So if you're scared or empty or half-a-step from a Section Eight, do you tell your men?  Of course not.  You bluff, you lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how do you bluff yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simple, numbers.  Every time you kill one of your men, you tell yourself you just saved the lives of two, three, ten, a hundred others. We lost, what, thirty-one on the cliffs?  I'll bet we saved ten times that number by putting out those guns.  That's over three hundred men.  Maybe five hundred.  A thousand. Then thousand.  Any number you want. See?  It's simple.  It lets you always choose mission over men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except this time, the mission IS a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the rub.  I liked Wade.  Who's Ryan?  If they're both standing in front of me and I have to shoot one or the other, how do I choose?  Look at my hand, there it goes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, I've got to tell you, I think you're about used up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're right, Keith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to take over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question helps Miller pull himself back together.  He looks at his hand and forces it to stop shaking again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but if I get any worse, you'll have to relieve me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) Just what I want to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Wade was the eleventh of the twelve, you're the last one still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let yourself get killed, if you do, they might make me give back the medal and then I won't be able to lip off to colonels anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do my best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake their heads at the madness of it all.  Miller Hell of a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller picks up his Thompson and looks around, re-orienti himself.  He's about ninety-five percent there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for drawing that machine gun off me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, that's my personal brand of stupidity, I feel kind of proprietary about it, if you do it again, you're busted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarge allows himself a slight smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller jerks his head for Sarge to follow.  They head bac to the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men are all in their private worlds, thinking of Wade No talk.  Miller and Sarge walk back into the clearing. Miller barks at the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up.  We're moving out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said we had an hour, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well now I'm saying we're moving out.  Get off your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men get up.  Jackson is a bit slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's the matter with you, Jackson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I ain't feeling so chipper on account of Wade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Wade?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one responds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, who the hell is Wade?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men exchange looks.  Jackson speaks for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I understand what you're doin', but I respectfully request permission to grieve in my own manner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll grieve the way I tell you to goddamned grieve.  There is no Wade, there was one, but he died a long time ago, he's been dead for so long you can hardly remember his name, you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I understand.  I don't like it, but I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, now get your goddamned gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men pick up their equipment and prepare to move out. Sarge and Miller exchange a silent look.  Miller shakes h head to himself, amazed that the men still allow this shi to work.  He knows they have no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller and his men walk along the road.  The men are sile grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller checks his map.  figures out where they are.  Fold up the map, points the way and they move out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More progress.  The men are still grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what the best possible thing that could happen is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep, you step on a rusty nail, get lockjaw, never say another word as long as you live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller laughs.  Miller I'll bite, Reiben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've given this a lot of thought, sir.  The best thing that could happen is, we find Ryan and he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sir, consider the possibilities. A:  Ryan is alive.  We have to take him back to the beach.  Knowing you, you don't let him carry my gear, even though he really should, and we all get killed, trying to keep him alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except for the last part, that one's not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B:  Ryan is dead.  He's been blown up by the German equivalent of Wade, whose name I know you don't want me to mention.  There's nothing to find. The biggest piece is the size of a pea.  We wander around, looking for him until the Germans pick us off, one after another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither do I, sir.  C:  And this is the worst one, we find Ryan and he's wounded.  Not only does he not carry my gear, we have to carry his gear. And him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we accomplish the mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.  But what if he dies on the way back?  you see what I'm saying, sir?  The best possible situation is, he's dead, we find his body, more or less intact, we grab one of his dog-tags and high-tail it back to the beach, or better yet, we head over to Caen and catch up with division.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has anyone ever told you, you're officer material?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a mystery to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one smiles, but they trudge a bit less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND OF HEAVY FIRING.  Miller checks a map in the br near the crossroads.  A sign reads:  "Ramelle 3 Km."  Mil folds up the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like we're going to beat those Kraut companies to Ramelle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Miller stops dead.  He listens, hearing somethin the others don't hear.  He motions for them to freeze, th do.  The SOUND grows louder.  It's an OMINOUS RUMBLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE RUMBLE turns into the ROAR OF A BIG GERMAN CONVOY.  T trucks, armored personnel carriers, a regiment of crack Wehrmacht troops.  Heavily armed.  Imposing.  Crossing a bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller and his men crowded into a culvert under the bridg Brush and debris partially shield the ends of the culvert

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry along the fields on either side of the road, trying to keep up with the vehicles.  MILLER AND HIS MEN Catch a glimpse of an approaching German Flank Squad.  They flatten themselves into the mucky water. Ready their weapons.  Prepare to fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaches the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: PAIR OF GERMAN PRIVATES
dialogues.text: See the culvert obscured by brush.  Move to check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is just about to open up on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sees his Flank Squad lagging behind and CALLS to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obey.  Hurry after the rest of the convoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Americans breathe again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder where they're going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same place we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson, at the mouth of the culvert, motions that the co is clear.  They head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gently-sloped valley with scattered farm cottages and s cultivated fields, bordered by ancient, moss-covered ston walls.  The twos is visible beyond. Miller and his men crouch-run to the cover of one of the stone walls.  Miller pulls out his binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FAR SIDE OF THE FIELD
dialogues.text: There's a large gathering of German troops and vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scans the Germans with his binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like tea time, maybe they're Brits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure hope so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think they're waiting for, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then they hear an OMINOUS RUMBLE, deeper and more threatening that that of the convoy.  The sound gets LOUD and LOUDER.  Miller and his men exchange looks.  They kno that sound, they don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: FOUR MASSIVE GERMAN TANKS
dialogues.text: Appear down the road, heading for the German soldiers who greet them enthusiastically.  The tanks are tigers, huge, far bigger than an American Sherman.  Each one, sixty-two tons, with a big 88-mm gun, four heavy machine guns and impregnable armor.  Each one, an infantryman's nightmare. There are four of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puts away the binoculars and jerks his head for his men to follow, low, along the wall.  The men are happy to do so, looking back nervously at the German tanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUNDS OF SPORADIC SMALL ARMS FIRE.  The town square a deserted battlefield, littered with burning debris, she casings and bodies, German and American and a few French civilians.  Miller and his men enter the square, weapons ready, leap-frogging from doorway to doorway. Miller and Sarge crouch-run to the cover of some overhang debris.  They listen, trying to pinpoint the exact source the firing. Sarge motions his guess.  Miller nods in agreement.  He signals for the men to follow him around, not toward, the firing. They move on, dashing from cover to cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen AMERICAN PARATROOPERS on the bridge exchange SPOR FIRE with a few German snipers hidden in the buildings ne the bridgehead.  The bridge has clearly been the scene of heavy fighting.  Craters, burning debris and shell casing are everywhere.  The bridge is intact, only slightly dama There are dozens of German bodies along the riverbank on both sides of the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: MILLER AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: Crouch-run and take cover as they get within sight of the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like they've been having a hell of a party, here, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE BRIDGE!  WE'RE COMING IN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG BUT GRIZZLED VOICE calls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KISS MY ASS, FRITZ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU FIRE AT US AND I'LL DO A HELL OF A LOT MORE THAN THAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHO WON THE '38 ARMY-NAVY GAME?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller turns to his men.  They all come up empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I HAVE NO FUCKING IDEA.  HERE WE COME. (to his men) Cover me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if our guys open up, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're only allowed to shoot at Germans, that's one of the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have it your way, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller takes a breath, then DASHES out into the open, tow the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: THE GERMAN SNIPERS OPEN UP
dialogues.text: Bullets SMASH INTO THE GROUND around Miller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POUR FIRE at the German positions, SURPRESSING THE GERMAN FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Paratroopers pour a HEAVY STREAM OF BULLETS at the German positions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller makes it to the bridge and DIVES over a defensive jumble of crates, sandbags and bodies. He finds himself next to SERGEANT BILL FORREST who was th young but grizzled voice that called out.  With Forrest a some very worn-out, young AMERICAN PARATROOPERS.  Miller catches his breath.  Forrest Navy, sir, twenty-one to nineteen.  They won on a field goal in overtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep it in mind. (calls to Sarge) OKAY, SARGE, ONE AT A TIME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller and the paratroopers FIRE COVER for Miller's men a they come in.  Miller and Forrest alternately take and FI Forrest Are we glad to see you, sir, we were supposed to hold this bridge for twenty-four hours, it's been six day

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things are tough all over.  We're looking for a Private James Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest Ryan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest motions to one of the paratroopers. Forrest Go get Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want him for, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller doesn't answer.  Jackson leaps over the barricade scrambles to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson, get a hold of command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson cranks up the five-thirty-five.  Miller turns to Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many men do you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pause to FIRE, covering Sarge, the last of Miller's to leap over the barricade. Forrest Eleven, sir.  We started with thirty-six.  The br was easy to take but the Krauts have been coming back at ever since.  They must want it intact or we'd be long gon Jackson speaks into the radio handset, repeating Miller's hailing I.D.   No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest Sir, what do you want with Ryan? Miller doesn't answer, he looks past Forrest and sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dashing from cover to cover, making his way toward them.  Ryan is an American classic, nineteen years old, earthy, handsome, sharp, cocky. Though he's exhausted, unshaven, and smeared with dirt and blood, he's very alive.  His eyes shine, his face has a spark.  You can't help but love this kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All watch Ryan run toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, that's Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a flaming asshole to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes remain glued to Ryan as he makes it to the barricade.  He salutes Miller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Ryan, sir.  You wanted to see me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller looks at Ryan for a moment, amazed that he's final face-to-face with him.  Ryan waits.  Miller hesitates, searching for words.  Then he speaks gently but clearly. Miller Private, I've got some bad news for you.  Your bro have been killed in action. The life instantly drains from Ryan.  His breath comes ha Somehow he remains upright. Ryan All three?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan sways.  Miller grabs him and eases him back, leaning him against some sandbags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are stunned at the news.  They look at Ryan, there's nothing else they can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also look at Ryan, but then, one after another, they turn away, adverting their eyes, looking a their own boots, the debris on the bridge, the sky, anything other than Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been sent to get you out of here.  You're going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan weakly waves Miller off.  Miller motions to his men the paratroopers to move away.  They do so, giving Ryan a little room. Forrest Three brothers, the poor son-of-a-bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant, we're moving out and I'm taking you and your men with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest But, sir, our orders are clear, we're to hold thi bridge until we're relieved by forward elements of the Tw ninth Division.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm giving you new orders, Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest Sir, you can't do that, these orders are from com

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to leave you and your men here to get killed.  Get them together, we're moving out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VOICE from behind them speaks simply, clearly, firmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all turn and see Ryan standing there.  Miller is abo to automatically rip Ryan a new asshole for contradicting him, but he quickly calms himself, gently touches Ryan on the arm and speaks softly to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Private, you're going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan jerks away from Miller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes are on Miller and Ryan.  Miller remains patient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Private.  I'm sorry about your brothers but staying here and getting yourself killed isn't going to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, if the Krauts are holding this bridge when division shows up, our guys are going to be sitting ducks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This bridge cannot be held.  The Germans have two companies less than three miles from here.  They have tanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That news clearly affects Ryan and the other paratroopers but Ryan holds his ground.  Ryan Sir, I'm still not going Miller speaks with restrained, but growing, anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Private, if you want to commit suicide, that's your choice, but you're going to have to wait until after I get you back to the beach. And you're not going to take these men with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan stands eye-to-eye with Miller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller starts to boil over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell you aren't, you're comin' with me if I have to drag you every inch of the way.  You hear me, Private?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you sir, but I'm not leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller grabs Ryan by the lapels and shakes him.  Ryan doe resist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen you little son-of-a-bitch you're coming with me or I'll...I'll...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan speaks softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do, sir, shoot me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller considers it.  Then REIBEN SPEAKS UP from behind Miller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (politely) Uh, excuse me, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller slowly turns and glares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) So, what are a few tanks, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller's more amazed than pissed off.  Reiben smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) He's right, we can't shoot him...well, we could but we'd get in an enormous amount of trouble.  And he's right about the bridge, it's a hell of a lot more important than he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cap'n...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller turns his glare on Jackson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Seems to me, we got us a opportunity, here, to kill two birds with one stone.  Command seems to think keepin' this boy alive is worth somethin'. If we was to do that and hold this bridge, good chance we'd get us a bucket full of medals.  I might even get me one 'a them big, fancy ones like you got, so's I could sass any officer in the whole dang army, you included.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller does a slow burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to stay, too, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do and personally, I'd rather get the hell out of here, but somebody's got to stay and take care of you and these pin-head privates of yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller looks at FORREST AND THE PARATROOPERS. Forrest We weren't planning on going anywhere, sir. Reiben smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, Captain?  The vote's unanimous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller's eyes almost pop out of his head.  Miller The vot What the hell are you talking about?  We don't vote.  Thi isn't a democracy.  This is the army, I give orders, you follow them.  We don't vote!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, of course, sir, I was merely speaking hypothetically.  IF this was a voting situation, then the vote would have been unanimous.  But of course, it's not a voting situation, you're the captain, and you give the orders, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're goddamned right, I give the order.  Vote!  Jesus Christ!  Listen to me, you little pissant pieces of shit, I am the ranking officer here and what I say goes, is that clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all quickly nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the others Yes, sir.  Yes, sir. Miller looks from face to face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that case... (beat) I vote we stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what they wanted to hear.  Miller doesn't give the time to enjoy it, he immediately starts barking orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reiben, the B.A.R., there.  Jackson, get up on the bridgekeepers hut with your sniper rifle.  Sarge, you and Upham move that machine gun so it can cover the left flank, it's worthless where it is.  Forrest, I want a full inventory of all your weapons, ammo and ordnance.  Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all hurry off, except for Ryan who locks eyes with M for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gruffly gentle) Yeah, yeah.  I want you right next to me, no matter where I go, you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan salutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller shakes his head at himself and strides off to chec the defensive perimeter with Ryan at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller and Reiben watch as Forrest, Ryan and a couple oth paratroopers lay out their weapons and ammo inventory. Forrest Two machine guns, twenty-two grenades, two Gammon grenades, six satchel charges, twenty-six M-1's, eight To guns and about sixty rounds per man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reiben looks at the sparse array of weaponry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, can I change my vote?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller sighs, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson, perched on the bridgekeepers hut, protected by a crescent of sandbags.  His eye is at his scope.  He FIRES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Falls from a window on the edge of town, dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sits beside Jackson with a pair of binoculars, searching for another target.  The German sniper fire has subsided for now.  Ext. bridge - day Miller watches as Ryan and several other paratroopers dig a series of trenches across the street, leading to the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reiben, Jackson and Upham, stone-faced, watch Ryan. Miller eyes the buildings near the bridge head.  He speak to Sarge who holds several satchel charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarge, see what you can do to make those buildings inhospitable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then they hear the sound of A BIG GUN FIRING IN THE DISTANCE.  They all turn at the sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty-eights, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell what the gunners had for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those guns are close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest Just south of town.  The Krauts have a two gun emplacement, we saw it on the way in.  That's how we knew they wanted the bridge intact, they didn't blow the crap of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hope they don't change their mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upham listens to the eighty-eights with particular intere

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within sight of the bridge.  Sarge carefully plants a wir triggered satchel charge at the door of the building.  He sets the wire, then carefully backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reiben and Ryan pile sandbags, finishing a forward machin gun nest.  Miller looks around, evaluating, Sarge and Uph at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if we had ten times the men and a lot more ammo, we might stand a chance, but not against those tanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to hope like hell the tanks were on their way somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe Caen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hope, because we're sure as hell not going to do any damage to them with what we have here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about our grenades?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are Tigers, they have six-inch armor, they don't even notice grenades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would they notice and eighty-eight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, you got one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Germans do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller is stone-faced, then he smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upham, go find Jackson, he and I are going hunting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upham runs off.  Sarge shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the mouth of babes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark.  Miller, Jackson and Forrest darken their faces wit blackening soot.  The rest of Miller's men and several paratroopers, including Ryan, look on.  Upham is distress Upham It was my idea, sir, you've got to let me go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upham, you've got to learn the difference between whining and griping.  You can't just rely on natural ability, you've got to study and practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go again, that's whining, that's not okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's better, but you've still got a long way to go.  Talk to Reiben, he's a natural and works at it, he'll give you some pointers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him to me, Captain, I'll have him pissing and moaning with the best of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RYAN Steps up to Miller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to go, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, private, I want you to stay here, keep your head down, don't do anything brave or stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't they the same thing, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reiben, I don't know what I'd do without you.  Sarge, keep Ryan close to you and alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller checks Jackson and Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You betcha, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller, Forrest and Jackson prepare to move out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (southern accent) Y'all come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reiben, are you makin' fun 'a the way I talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heavy southern accent) Hell, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson shoots him a glare, then he follows Miller and Fo into the darkness.  Sarge, Ryan and the other watch them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A German eighty-eight FIRES, sending its big shell into t night.  It's eight-man crew re-loads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slight movement.  It's Miller.  He crawls to the edge of the emplacement and freezes in the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment later he's joined by Forrest.  A moment after th Jackson silently crawls up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes the emplacement.  Looks for a weakness.  There is none.  He motions to Forrest and Jackson to wait.  The three of them settle into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarge, Upham and Reiben sit with Ryan in the darkness.  R is lost in thought, far away.  One after another, Miller' men eye him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Private, I'm sorry about your brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan nods.  Then, with some difficulty, he makes the trip from Iowa back to France.  He turns to Sarge.  Ryan What the name of the guy who got killed coming up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade.  Huh, he died coming up here to keep me alive...I never met him...he didn't know me from Adam, strange.  What was he like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A good man, kind of cheerful, Reiben, here, used to call him a happy idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like hell, I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brothers would be mighty pissed off at me, if they knew I let some guy get killed trying to keep me alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't let anybody get killed, you didn't even know we were coming up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I know, but... (sighs) Goddamn it all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others nod in agreement.  They look closely at Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark.  No firing.  Two German soldiers on watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Miller.  Easing through the darkness.  Closer to one of the sentries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller sees Jackson easing up behind another sentry.  Mil nods to Jackson.  They move at the same moment.  Behind t sentries.  SLIT THEIR THROATS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest removes the wheel-blocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaches.  He sees Forrest.  Just as he's about to open up with his sub-machine gun, Miller grabs him from behind, STABS him, eases the body silently to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Join Forrest at the eighty-eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Together they attach the eighty-eight's carriage to the German's truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rounds a corner.  Sees them.  OPENS UP WITH HIS SUB-MACHINE GUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forrest DIVES, FIRES BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Race over, FIRING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Covering them, OPENS UP.  Kills the advancing Germans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILLER frantically attaches the eighty-eight to the truck FORREST CUTS DOWN, several more Germans. JACKSON TAKES A GRAZING SHOT IN THE SHOULDER. Spins. Still FIRING. Giving Miller cover. MILLER LEAPS into the cab of the truck. JACKSON AND FORREST LEAP into the back. JACKSON FIRES into the approaching Germans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is shattered by bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass flies everywhere, cutting Miller on the face and ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spraying the Germans with his Thompson. MILLER FLOORS IT. The truck DRIVES through the Germans. The Germans FIRE at the truck and trailing eighty-eight. MILLER, JACKSON AND FORREST Drive into the night. The Germans FIRING after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller, Jackson and Forrest barrel down the road through gauntlet of Germans.  As they approach the bridge, the ot American's FIRE COVER for them. Miller drives the truck onto the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: SMASHES INTO THE SANDBAGS
dialogues.text: THE OTHER AMERICANS, with Ryan in the lead, leap over the barricade and drag the captured eighty-eight onto the bri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RYAN!  GET BACK THERE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan ignores him.  They get the eighty-eight safely behin the barricade.  Miller grabs Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller fumes.  he sees Reiben, Sarge and Upham, shrugging clearly not pissed at Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do that again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't need to sir, it's already here, behind the barricade so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller GROWLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller glares at Ryan, then strides off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller and Upham carefully dig up a German mine.  Very gingerly they place it on a growing pile of other mines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller and Ryan lay a mine into the dirt.  They cover it step back carefully. Then they proceed with the next.  Upham is covering their tracks while Jackson is digging the holes in which they'l place the rest of the mines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet.  Dark.  Everything is ready.  There's nothing to d now but wait.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BRIDGEKEEPERS HUT
dialogues.text: Reiben and Jackson sit behind the sandbags.  They can see Ryan sitting in the moonlight about twenty yards away, ma the rear machine gun nest with Sarge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm we got that eighty-eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, Ryan, what do you think of him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't half-bad, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're quiet for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't Wade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope, he ain't Wade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes keep coming back to Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crouch-runs through the shadows and stops at the bridgekeepers hut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reiben...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller points, directing Reiben to the forward machine gu nest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REIBEN jumps down and moves forward. MILLER runs across the bridge and joins Sarge and Ryan in the rear machine gun nest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You set?  Sarge nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller and Sarge exchange a look.  Then Miller slips off check the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First light.  The Americans are ready for battle.  WE SEE them in their positions:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manning the forward machine gun nest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the sandbags, on top of the bridgekeeper's hut.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST AND THE PARATROOPERS
dialogues.text: Behind the second of two barricades set up between the fo and the rear machine gun nests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manning rear machine gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the bridgehead, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: SOUND FROM DOWN THE ROAD
dialogues.text: All eyes turn.

dialogues.speaker: SINGLE GERMAN SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Dashes across the street.  Exposed only for an instant. Then another.  And another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocks his Thompson.  Settles down behind some sandbags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HERE THEY COME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPENS UP with the MACHINE GUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least fifty of them, advancing on the bridge.  Running from cover to cover.  A squad pushing a French truck, using it as a shield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calmly picking off the attacking Germans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make their way down the streets. Along the riverbank.  Through the houses.  There are GERMANS FIRING from all directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sees Reiben and Upham being cut off. Grabs the B.A.R., stands and fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running out of ammo.  See that there's nothing else they can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reiben rolls out of the nest, carrying the fifty caliber. Upham follows, carrying the ammo boxes.  They run as fast they can.

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER AMERICANS FIRE COVER
dialogues.text: REIBEN takes a glancing slug.  Falls.  Rolls and gets up. Bleeding from the side, but not mortal.  Upham helps him. They MAKE IT TO THE SANDBAGS of the first barricade. DIVE OVER.  The Germans are almost on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the rear MACHINE GUN.  Drops several Germans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They swarm over the first barricade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIRES A BURST into a German's belly. HITS another with the stock of his Thompson.

dialogues.speaker: FORREST AND THE OTHER PARATROOPERS
dialogues.text: FIRING COVER for Miller, Reiben and Upham, don't see a flanking Germans squad easing along the riverbanks.  Two the Germans LOB POTATO MASHERS among the paratroopers.  T PARATROOPERS see the grenades.  Too late.

dialogues.speaker: PARATROOPERS RYAN SEES FORREST AND THE OTHERS DIE
dialogues.text: No time to react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half a dozen Germans break through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller KILLS TWO MORE WITH A BURST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is jumped on by one.  Upham FIRES. KILLS the German.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Struggling with a pair of Germans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIRES.  Drops one of the Germans on Miller with a head shot.  Cuts open Miller's face with bits of skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaps onto the final German attacking Miller.  That German raises his rifle on Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: UPHAM AND REIBEN AND JACKSON
dialogues.text: All see it.  SIMULTANEOUSLY SHOOT the German.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About to kill Ryan.  Torn apart by bullets from three directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like hell you did, I got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILLER SLAMS in a fresh clip.  FIRES an arc.  DROPS four Germans.  Sees an oncoming RUSH OF GERMANS.  BARKS to Rei and Upham:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK!  LET'S GO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They retreat, firing back as best they can, trying to mak it to the barricade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sees them in deep trouble.  Leaves Ryan firing the rear machine gun. Grabs the B.A.R. ADVANCES, FIRING COVER.  Exposed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILLER, REIBEN, UPHAM make it to the barricade.  Dive over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sees they've made it.  FIRES A FINAL BURST.  Races for cover.  A trail of bullets right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE OTHER AMERICANS FIRE for all they're worth.  Trying t cover Sarge.  Too many Germans.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE TAKES A SHOT IN THE BACK. FALLS. MILLER AND THE O
dialogues.text: continue to fire, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE STRUGGLES TO HIS FEET
dialogues.text: Cradling the B.A.R.  Stumbling toward cover.  Slowing. Bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desperately trying to cover him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open up with a volley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is almost there.

dialogues.speaker: ALL THE AMERICANS STAND AND FIRE
dialogues.text: As best they can.  Right past Sarge.  It's not enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five feet from the sandbags, his back is TORN APART by Germans fire. He looks down, stunned at his chest. Amazed to see GAPING HOLES.  An instant of surprise, more than fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks to Miller.  Takes two more stumbling steps.  Fal onto the sandbags.  Dropping the B.A.R. over the edge.  D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who killed Sarge are killed.  The others back off for now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REIBEN, UPHAM, JACKSON, RYAN fire at the retreating Germa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grabs Sarge and pulls him over the barricade.  Sees that he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: THE GERMANS RETREAT.
dialogues.text: Around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunned, lays Sarge down, kneeling next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch, start to gather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it...Goddamn it...Goddamn it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back to your positions!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hesitate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They follow the order.  All except Ryan, who doesn't move He can't take his eyes off Sarge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't move.  He just stares at Sarge's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks at Miller, sees him growing weak, starting to sway.  He gently tries to move Miller aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of Sarge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller looks up at Ryan, then back at Sarge's body.  Mill grows cold, making the same startling transformation he m as he kneeled over Wade's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarge?  Who's Sarge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this time it doesn't work.  He can't make it stick. hard expression, disappears.  He drifts, utterly lost.  H called his own bluff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark.  Quiet.  The distant guns are silent for once. Waiting.  Reiben, Upham, Jackson, Ryan and Miller have tightened their perimeter. Miller is in a trance.  The others glance at him nervousl They eat in silence.  K-rations.  Some bread.  A last sup Then, from out of nowhere, Miller speaks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: English teacher, Addley, Pennsylvania.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
